title: Absolutely excellent professional caring service
body:
Yes Absolutely excellent professional caring service from Reception staff to GP’S. 

They make sure you are treated fairly from phones call to walk in service.

title: Absolutely excellent professional caring service
body:
Yes Absolutely excellent professional caring service from Reception staff to GP’S. 

They make sure you are treated fairly from phones call to walk in service.

title: Extremely professional GP
body: GP was fully up to speed on my recent and complicated medical history and very very helpful on all matters. Not a minute of the consultation was wasted. First class.

title: Helpful staff
body: I have been registered with the practice (Gillingham branch) for 19 years. It's gone through a lot of changes,but at all times I have found the whole team to be professional and helpful. I have been concerned about the changes in ability to book face to face appointments, but fully understand the rationale of minimising risk to front line staff.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Front of house staff very helpful & pleasant. Comfortable clean safe surroundings. The specialist was very knowledgeable and professional and gave his time to make sure he was understood. I felt like I was listened to with understanding, I didnt feel like I had a time slot, I felt at ease and comfortable to ask questions without feeling I was taking up his time. Came away feeling calm, reassured & knowing I can contact them to be seen again should I need to. A very very pleasant experience, and a refreshing change.

title: Brilliant receptionists!
body:
I called the surgery today and there appear to be new receptionists at the practice who are far superior and friendlier than the old guard!! I'm apparently not allowed to name the fab lady who recommended that I contact the Out of Hours surgery or GP Hub as it is also sometimes known as I wasn't aware of this service. 

The OOO surgery were very busy as I tried to get through quite a few times but I persevered and managed to get through at 17:00 and spoke to a very professional agent who advised that a doctor would call me back within an hour and I was called back within 5 mins. 

The doctor on call listened to the details of my condition, checked which was the nearest pharmacy to me, recommended what I needed and said that the treatment I required would be ready for me to pick up immediately from one of the pharmacists I prefer to use.  I am therefore extremely suitably impressed with this service and so I would say to all those patients who constantly moan and whine about how they can't get an appointment or a consultation, to please spare a thought for the amazing receptionists who, quite frankly, have to put up with an awful lot in terms of abuse and impatience as we are totally stuffed if they get sick!! 

We are lucky to have such a good practice in E18 when the NHS is totally crumbling around us and shows no signs of any assistance from the Government as regards alleviating the constant pressure it is under as an organisation.  Please treat our remarkable receptionists with respect as they are the gateway to us getting better! Thank you ladies!

title: Wonderful experience
body: I have used Gloucester Rd Medical Centre since moving locally in 2019. Every contact to date has been exemplary- appointments given when we needed, appropriate treatments delivered, and thoughtful communications about what was going on. I have used the surgery twice this month for my children and both times felt incredibly well looked after. I am really pleased to be part of this surgery.

title: Amazing service
body:
They were extremely busy but saw me as quickly as they possibly could. They then provided 1st class service from reception to technicians, nurses, doctors etc. all with a smile and the most caring nature. 
We are so lucky to have such a wonderful service in Taunton, I can't rate them highly enough for what they do!

title: Amazing staff at ward 16
body: I was there for a week with my little 1 in ward 16 and i cant praise them enough. Ive always hward bad reviews so i was a little anxious but the staff were amazing so caring towards my little one and me. So easy to approach and gentle.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: So grateful. Thank you!
body: Was Looked after by the amazing community midwives for a home birth. Such lovely and supportive people. Unfortunately my birth did not progress as planned and had to do transfer to hospital in ambulance. Once in hospital everything moved very quick and the doctors were very reassuring and clear in their communication. The non-human element seemed to be the only problem. Can someone please give the maternity ward some money to update their equipment? The skill of the staff saved the day though and I’m so grateful for all the care and attention given to me and my baby. I feel incredibly lucky to have access to this amazing hospital and maternity care.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent staff, lovely surroundings and decor
body: Right from the moment you walk in, they had an understanding and dealt with you very fast and very efficient in a caring manner, made you feel at ease and gave you confidence that you'll come through this.

readBy.name: Birmingham and Solihull Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Service
body: Responded very quickly to an on line request. Arranged an evening appointment to accommodate  my  work commitments.Very professional and outstanding from the person who called as a follow up to my initial enquiry, to the front of house receptionist and to the doctor I saw.Excellent work well done.

title: Excellent service
body: I sent a message this afternoon within an hour I had a reply. Medication issued and a follow up appointment booked. Thank you so so much for the speedy action taken to help resolve my situatuon. Credit where credit is due. Well done to everyone who hooked me up today. Thank you all so much. Great job team.

title: Covid-19 vacances
body: Had my Covid-19 jab what wonderful helping people everyone should be so grateful for all of your work.Thank you each & everyone.

title: No concept of time
body: This is the second time I’ve asked for an earliest appointment for the nurse. I am given 8am as this is the earliest. There seems to be a pattern of the nurse always arriving after me!!! And then I am not seen till after 8.30. Absolutely ridiculous as I have to put a leave of absence in and timings. You wouldn’t expect the first appointment of the day to be delayed by 30 minutes! I am very annoyed.!!!!

title: Appointment line is like the Hunger Games Contest
body: Today I have had 2 phone lines trying to get an answer from the appointment line at Ashville Medical Practice.  1 was ringing from 2pm to 2.35, the other from 2.25pm to 2.35 - I finally got through and the receptionist put the phone down on me when I started to speak - all I said was - I realise you are very busy today - I didn't even get chance to say why I was phoning - now the phone line is engaged again and I can't get through.  I know it's virtually impossible to get a GP appointment.  That's why I didn't bother trying until I'm absolutely desperate with a physical problem I have been experiencing for the past 6 months which is seriously affecting my day to day living.  Trying to get an appointment is like being a contestant in the Hunger Games with about as much chance of success. I guess that I'm not the only person who feels like this.   My NHS rainbow is coloured in with a variety of shades of brown.

title: Covid unsafe
body: Patients don’t wear the masks in the waiting room, staff don’t, no one is asking patients to put them on. I’ve sat in for 20mins to see everyone without masks. They have a sign saying it’s mandatory but no one is implementing it. What does the management do??

title: Experience with the practice nurse
body: I attended today for my smear test with the nurse. Obviously this procedure can be embarrassing and uncomfortable, but I can assure you that the lovely nurse made me feel completely, at ease and I barely felt a thing. In fact it was over within a couple of minutes. Not only did the procedure go really smoothly but the nurse was just so friendly and made me feel super relaxed and comfortable. I will be certainly booking in with her again - without any hesitation. She also did my flu jab for me. All rolled into one appointment, saving me going back again. Thank you Brooke road surgery, always going above and beyond for your patients.

title: Experience of Practice
body:
This is my experience of this practice.

Letter from hospital to GP prescribing a further medication not acted upon by practice until I chaised.  

Practice found the letter than had 'just be' filed on my notes.

Prescription finally issued 

Not a good service.

title: Lack of Communication
body: Website advises surgery open from 8.30, however after attempting 96 times to make contact as line was constantly busy and eventually when getting through no appointments being available,  I found out that the surgery is open from 8am and if you stand any chance of getting an appointment you need to queue up outside before 8am. Upon conclusion of the telephone appointment the gp asked me to call in to the surgery as late in the day as possible so I could collect my meds and fit note. I arrived at the surgery at 3pm to find it was closed due to staff training. So now I have no medication for this evening. I wasn’t told by the receptionist when making the appointment or the gp that the surgery was unexpectedly closing early today.

title: The best Gp surgery
body:
This surgery has looked after me I find every member of staff happy to help me 25 years may be more. All threw covid I saw how they worked tirelessly thank you all so much 
Everyone at lockfield

title: Very good doctors. And receptionist.
body: This doctors has looked after me very friendly doctors. And receptionist. Thank you all for your help and support.

title: Flu jab
body: Nurse was excellent all done very quickly and professionally. Only problem was I arrived for my appointment early and by the time I waited behind people asking for sick notes etc my time slot was late so it would help to have a sign pointing people to the correct window to save waiting behind people, only to be directed to the window around the corner.

title: Great Service
body:
Called as my son was unwell receptionist was lovely, booked me in for a telephone call . The doctor called and agreed he needed to be seen asked to come in seen straight away , checked over and given antibiotics and booked in for a follow up in a week . Amazing 
Well Done everyone

title: Recepection are unfair
body:
And there Attitude towards there Patients turning them away telling there Patients there are no Apointmeants or face face and they turned a Gentlmen away with Suffring with Headaces there Discuting attitude  and more needs to be done I'm not impressed with the Deepings doctors shame on them that's why parents and patients are going to A.E 
Sort these issues out the doctors are fantastic but the  Receptionists there attitude stinks WHY?Are they turing us away and saying there are No Apointmeants and No Face To Face

title: Shocking service
body: Been trying to get an appointment for my scan for 3 weeks so far. Every time I ring the number on the letter I get a message saying it’s closed even though the times on the letter say they aren’t. Absolutely diabolical service . I would rather live with my symptoms than go with this service again. Still haven’t got my appointment

author: EOH
title: Lack of services for over 30's on the Autistic Spectrum.
body:
I am the parent of a 30-year old on the Autistic Spectrum who had a social worker until they were 17 years of age. At this time their IQ was reassessed and with a score of 79-87 they were deemed as no longer requiring additional support from learning support services within the Southern Trust. They would have needed a score of 70 or below to allow them to continue accessing services - a very small margin in points has made a world of a difference. When I request support I am told that Trusts do not received funding for people on the Autistic Spectrum who are over 30. Just because someone is 30 years of age does not mean the condition and difficulties they having been living with all their life suddenly disappear.  
They are now 30 years of age and only able to access 4 hours voluntary work per week due to lack of a social worker. This has had a negative impact on their physical and mental well-being. A social worker would be able to refer him to additional services and enable us to apply for Self-Directed Support Payments. This would allow us to access additional hours at the community organisation where they currently work voluntarily for 4 hours per week, as well as other services within the community. They love the work and come alive when there.  
They have not been reassessed in the past 11 years - I've been told there would be no point as there likely wouldn't be a change. No one has listened to me, his mother, when I have said I see them deteriorating. They would not be able to live independently and my constant worry is what happens when I am no longer here . This worry has weighed me down to the point where I now feel physically, mentally and emotionally drained. I am requesting a reassessment of IQ through this site as my requests are falling on deaf ears in community services.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Very poor
body: Unfortunately I do not like to leave poor reviews, especially after being a patient at this practice all my life, but now I worry about my children's care using this facility. I am currently trying to move practices and will have to travel further to do so. The system is not working, its stressful, and near on impossible to get through or get an appointment. The staff and nurses are lovely and I really don't want this to be a reflection on them as I know its a relentless task for them at the minute.  However, the powers that be need to take a serious look at their current systems and the reason so many are now attending A&E. 534 phone calls last week and still no appointment!! When you do get an appointment if you are lucky its a telephone call, then if they need to see you that's another appointment. So what use to be one face to face appointment is now 2 appointments. So no wonder they cannot fit anyone in.  Why are you not back to face to face when the rest of the country is? I do hope things improve but it is a worry.

author: Ele79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Roddens Residential Home
body: I have only been in here for one week and the staff are very good to you.They care for you well.I am happy and content here.The food is good  as well.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Ele79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Roddens Residential Home
body: I have been a resident for a few years and am well looked after.The place is very clean and tidy.The food is good .The staff ask what you want of the menu  and there is a good choice.I am able to go for a walk and get the newspapers.Philip the manager is good he buys me sausage rolls.Philip is full of life and talks to you.Rachel is friendly, and all the staff are friendly.Linda who works in the laundry runs a very good service .

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: A&E
body:
Advice and letter off GP to attend A&E still
Sitting there 8 hours later not happy at all appauling I get emergency come in but no updates what so ever just read board I get told I am a 64 year old and the people telling are my daughters age and my granddaughter age the have no compassion at all for people waiting poor customer service

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Miss Button
title: Holistic and humane approach
body:
I had an unusual and heart warming experience of NHS services as someone who is often judged through the lens of a mental health diagnosis given to me by psychiatry which often results in professionals within NHS regardless of discipline making assumptions on my character.  
This was from a physiotherapist within the pain management clinic who treated me with respect and dignity that allowed me to see my strengths and abilities to manage my chronic pain condition. The physiotherapist treated me with a holistic approach, taking into consideration all areas of my life. She showed compassion and empathy for the difficulties I experience at the same time as encouraging me to use my own knowledge and determination to manage my lifestyle to in a way that means I can live my life to my fullest potential despite the pain condition I have.  
Acceptance of a chronic pain condition can be a difficult journey but through the positive reinforcement of my own resilience and coping strategies by this physiotherapist, it has enable me to take control and personal responsibility for believing in my own abilities to manage this. This is the most empowering approach I believe any professional can offer as this strength based ethos has allowed me to maintain my autonomy and agency for my own wellbeing. I must make it clear that this approach also involved much support and education related to my condition and I feel the physiotherapist worked alongside me in this process.  
I did not have much input in terms of hours/sessions however, this was very appreciated by me as the honesty and authenticity of the physiotherapist about my condition meant for me, that I could move forward and build on the strategies I already possess.  
I would like to thank the physiotherapist, C, for your input and consistent respect and validation of my experience. To be seen as a whole person where your approach was not being overshadowed with my mental health diagnosis was invaluable to me. Your patience, as I struggled with accepting my condition and exploration through our conversations is commendable to you. I hope others have the opportunity to benefit from your approach as I have.  
To be treated in a holistic way is vital for anyone I think that receives treatment of any kind and I hope other professionals are able to learn from your approach to anyone receiving treatment in any health setting.  
Thank you so much for your approach, respect, authenticity and understanding. I will take this forward in my own management of my pain condition.  
[Very happy with 'Seeing the whole me']

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: CotfieldF
title: Eye clinic appointment
body:
Disappointed with my poor patient experience this morning at the BGH Eye clinic. We had a routine screening appointment for a 4 year old eye test.  
We arrived at the BGH 20 mins in advance of appointment to find a complete lack of parking. Eventually parked outwith the hospital in nearby town of Darnick and walked two small children in tow. 7 minutes late to reception and whilst feeling exacerbated (and a bit puffed out from running) was told I'd need to rebook. I was hugely disappointed with with lack of flexibility as the next patient had been taken in aged of time I feel we could have been seen after with not much disruption to the days schedule.  
Lack of empathy and person centred care and ultimately insufficient parking to cope with demand.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: montesa
title: prostate cancer
body: I had my prostate removed by robotic surgery in Lister hospital January 2020 and then handed back to Luton and Dunstable for regular PSA blood tests under the urology department. The staff and doctors were very supportive and doing a great job in hard times, but now my PSA is rising from 0.03 after my op to 0.06 6 months later. It is now 1.00 but my doctor thinks that's fine. I thought I should not have a PSA reading or at least 0.01 at most, as I have no prostate, The problem is trying to get an answer from someone to say yes that's fine or your doctor is incorrect.

author: Bansd43
title: Lovely staff
body:
I had a great experience, thanks for your hard work and very welcoming, professional and very well explained help.  
Keep up the great work!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Boona
title: Disgraceful experience
body:
I was admitted to this ward from my GP and it is one of the most disgraceful experiences I've ever endured.  
Treated like a piece of dirt on their shoe. Left for hours in a room on a Swivel chair. A member of staff patronised me and fobbed me off and advised me that nothing was wrong and that my issue wouldn't cause me any pain or any problems. It turns out they were completely wrong and they continued to be wrong in their diagnosis.  
I had to be diagnosed and have surgery privately.  
They will never know the trauma I've endured or the terrible effect all of this has had on me.

author: Claire008
title: I LOVE going to my Meetings!!!!
body:
I attend on a session at Wisbech on Monday at 1730hrs (although I’m always fashionably late), as Adrian will tell you!  
Honestly, I have to say, I really look forward to it… the guys, Adrian, Steve and Mark, are brilliant!!! (As are all of them - Everyone is genuinely friendly)!!  
They make it fun whilst giving out great info and advice, and I know a lot of effort goes into the planning (although Adrian does need to improve on his drawing skills) 🤣🤣🤣  
I love that they are so non judgemental… and make you feel like you aren’t alone on this journey. Listening to their experiences … knowing that they’ve been there really helps! We’re not being preached to!  
I love the honesty, and genuine care, and this shines through… and in the short time I’ve been attending, I can see how relaxed this makes the group, and makes people open up! Its also a great bunch of people that attend!  
Who would’ve thought I’d be looking forward to a rehab group session so much!!!  
You are all doing a fantastic job, and I think I can speak for all of us…. I normally do 🤣 we’d be lost without you!

author: waltzxe45
title: Telephone consultation
body: I had a telephone consultation today with a doctor and it went very well. He asked me all the right questions and informed me I was on all the right medication for my needs.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Denny52
title: Impressive service
body: I was referred to Rapid Assessment Respiratory Hub at Lagan Valley through accident and emergency. The response time was quick. When I arrived I was taken in on time. Things were explained well. I was very impressed. I got all the help that was needed in one appointment. Thank you

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Gil48
title: Care and compassion given by nurses
body:
I was admitted to ward 26 at Ninewells hospital Dundee in Nov 21 for planned surgery. I have two nurses who in particular I want to thank with all my heart. First nurse, Ross, who was in charge of night shift on the ward. I was so nervous about my 12 hour surgery the next day. He made time for me to listen and some of the pre-op preparation which wasn't pleasant was done by him but he really put me at ease so I didn't worry as much. A top nurse who the NHS is lucky to have. Secondly nurse assistant, Ryan. I've met Ryan before after my op in April. When I was told in the morning of my op that it wasn't going ahead due to no ICU beds I was so upset. Ryan was so caring and he was like having a member of my family being with me while I got the tears out. The built up to the operation only to be told it wasn't going ahead was one of the worst days of my life as operation was on my bowel cancer. This experience was horrible, Ryan just sat and listened and showed the most wonderful compassion. Another of Ninewells gems who I hope to meet again at my next scheduled operation.  
All the nurses are wonderful and hate picking out two but it's worth they get praise along with the ward senior nurse on ward 26 ....sorry didn't take their name which I feel bad about.

author: hydrusxz66
title: first class treatment and monitoring
body:
An ultra sound scan for something unrelated showed a thickening on the back of the bladder wall. I was referred to and seen very quickly at the urology department of North Devon District Hospital.  
I had no symptoms of bladder cancer and so consider myself very fortunate that the bladder cancer was discovered and diagnosed at an early stage.  
A tumour was removed via a cystoscopy carried out under general anaesthetic followed by six weeks of chemotherapy. A further cystoscopy showed the cancer had become higher grade and more aggressive. Since then I have had a six week induction course of BCG immunotherapy treatment, after which there was no sign of recurrence, followed by a three week maintenance course of BCG treatment. I'm now awaiting a further cystoscopy before a second three week maintenance course of BCG treatment.  
Throughout this situation I cannot fault the service I've received from every member of staff at the hospital. They have kept me fully informed at every stage, and my clinical nurse specialist has always been available to answer any queries or concerns I have.  
It's a great benefit that North Devon District Hospital has the facilities to treat cancer patients such as myself.The hospital is less than a half an hour drive from home, parking is easy, and I'm usually back home in just over an hour after leaving for the weekly treatments. Keeping it local takes a lot of stress out of the whole procedure, and doesn't impact too greatly on treatment days.  
I am very appreciative of the team at the hospital, and have every confidence that I will receive first class treatment and monitoring in the future.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful
body:
Everytime I've been to triage I've been treated badly. Spoken to badly made to feel like I shouldn't be here. 
I was left with ecoli for three weeks before they realised. 

Everytime is a 4 hour wait even with appointment. 

More interested in chatting behind the desk then speeding things up. 

Have complained twice and still bad service. This really needs to be looked into.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

author: Magsy83
title: Great friendly speedy thorough service
body: Went in for my implant. Was well informed and clear about tge procedures. Staff were friendly and warming. Great service

author: Kidda
title: Nurses behaviour towards patients and towards each other.
body:
I recently spent several weeks in Station 3 whilst awaiting and recovering from surgery.  
In all of my 20 years of nursing I never once witnessed the level of conflict among staff as I did here. Whilst I am realistic in my understanding that not everyone will see eye to eye, I have never seen behaviour like this on the shop floor. Angry outbursts, whispering behind backs and on two separate occasions the use of foul language. I was yelled at by a nurse (in front of doctors ) because I tried to help a fellow patient in need and was informed they were very busy. I was ignored on more than one occasion and felt ridiculed by a night nurse because I was unable to pass urine and was begging to be re-catheterised.  
The housekeeping staff were fantastic and truly cared. They were a welcome sight each day and were only too willing to help in any way they could.  
Whilst I understand that staff are over worked etc etc I think patients deserve better. Compassion would be nice, patience would be lovely. Instead of the 'coiled springs' supposedly caring for us.  
Don't get me wrong not every member of the nursing team falls under this umbrella. Some were lovely but unfortunately they were few and far between at times.  
When you're in hospital you're ill. You're vulnerable and at times frightened. Many weeks with no contact with loved ones thanks to covid. I discovered when I got home that loved ones had rung most days to ask about me. Not once was I told that anyone had called. Trust me, patients deserve to know that loved ones are taking the time to call. It's all they have in this current climate. I feel that some members of staff need reminding that they are in a caring profession.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Cm41
title: Fantastic care
body: Fantastic care from nurse Iona, her nursing and people skills are exemplary. Attended the unit twice, and both times felt so at ease. Relaxed and calm atmosphere in the unit too! If only every ward was full of ‘I onas’!

author: DJJ21
title: Covid and flu booster vaccine
body: Staff in Kingsgate Vaccination centre we’re excellent! Courteous reception, friendly and knowledgeable support workers and nurses. Good teamwork. Thank you all for the amazing job you’re doing to keep us all safe!

author: Laura270187
title: High standard at the George Eliot hospital
body:
As I tested positive for covid and I had a suspected blood clot I was placed on a ward where I was treated by drs and nurses. The service I received was incredible. They didn’t treat me any different considering I was a covid patient.  
I was worried I would be stereotyped and judged for having the virus however the team at George Elliot hospital were warm, caring, pro-active, professional, kind and attentive to my needs. From the Porter picking me up from outside a and e to being treated, I have to say the end to end process was to such a high standard. I want to thank every individual for being so nice to me. You never once singled me out or treated me like I was infectious. Thank you so much!

title: Wonderful staff
body: I moved to Castle Medical in August and have been so impressed, right from speaking to the cheerful receptionist initially about whether or not I could join the practice to the pharmacist who spoke to me at length about my medical history and medications. I have spoken to an advanced nurse practitioner who has been incredibly helpful, and even had a face to face appointment with a GP! The website is very well constructed, easy to find information, and very informative. Being able to book a telephone appointment online the night before is an added bonus.  Thoroughly recommend Castle Medical - fantastic service.

author: Poppy Em
title: Amazing staff
body:
Amazing staff for my biopsy procedure, and a very well organised ward. The consultant explained in detail what was going to happen before during and after my operation. She didn't rush and I didn't feel she was on a time scale even though ward was very busy.  
The nurses were amazing (especially one with a great sense of humour). Pain relief was provided instantly when needed and also pre-empted before procedure. Very reassuring staff in the actual surgery room too. I was given lots of info regarding after care too. The ward was nipping clean and I basically don't have a bad word to say about my stay. Thank you ward 15.

title: Disappointed
body: This is the second review in less than 2 weeks,After my mum was admitted to hospital with pneumonia which the doctor could of picked up on if he had of done the basic test ie stats,pulse & BP & she could of been prescribed medication but no she ended up in A & E for 5 hours then she was admitted. Then today I tried to make her appointment at the surgery after explaining her symptoms to be told there are no appointments till next week,the receptionist did give me the number for devonshire house.I phoned them & got a a appointment for my mum that afternoon,it turned out to be cellulitis.The staff were fantastic & told my mum if she had anymore problems dont hesitate to get back in touch.Hatfield Health centre needs to sort yourselfs out & start thinking about your patients,not impressed with this surgery

title: Appalling
body: I have spent over 3 hrs over the last few days waiting to get through.  I have had medication denied despite being advised by hospital that my GP should prescribe!  I have been passed around without any solution, having to make numerous calls!  X3 promised calls were not made to me.   The right hand doesn’t seem to know what the left hand is doing!  I witnessed more than x3 patients being told the same as me .. to calm the next day for an appointment … these included patients who had just seen the doctor who advised to go to reception to make an appointment!  Clearly suffering from compassion fatigue … ie robotic and No empathy at all!

author: ClaireH1
title: Outstanding Care
body: The care I have received on ward 26 from all the nurses involved in my care has been outstanding. I would like to thank Ruth, Holly, Mhairi, Megan, Mary, Sophie, Hannah and Louise, and the wonderful Mr Suddiqui. From the first day I met them to plan the care the patience they all had for me was terrific. I can’t thank you all enough - what a wonderful team you all art. Thank you all so much.

links.id: felt confidence with the whole staff

title: filthy blood splattered areas
body: dirty blood splattered bed and room when i went for a ct scan. shocked at conditions I was exposed to, especially during a pandemic, I would have expected it to be cleaner.

title: Great service during times of covid
body: I have been very happy with the service my daughter and I have received from the practice over the last year. We have used the online form (which I find user-friendly) a few times and have received prompt replies, with what I think has been appropriate action (telephone consultation, in-person appointment or just a reassuring message). I would like to thank the staff, both medical and administrative, for their professional and caring approach during what must be an incredibly stressful time.

title: Wonderful staff
body: I attended my appointment at 8.30am on Tuesday 23/11/21 for a Retinal Angiogram. The nurse who looked after me was professional, welcoming and friendly. She explained everything clearly to me and ensured I understood what was going to be done. She is a credit to your service - I hope this feedback reaches her. First class all round.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great experience
body: I accompanied my father to have an xray today. The booking process was simple. The instructions of where to attend were clear. I was able to drop him off outside the entrance to the building which was incredibly important as his mobility is impaired. You have clearly thought about that and have taken the care to provide seating in the entrance area. The route to the xray department was well signed so we found it in moments. All of the staff we encountered were caring and supportive. The environment was clean and he was taken care of promptly and supportively. Well done to the team at the Royal Hallamshire and the team supporting bookings! You are all a credit to the NHS and you should be incredibly proud of everything you do to care for patients and their loved ones. Thank you so much!

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: orchid lover
title: Excellent care in Orthopaedic day surgery
body:
I can't praise or thank the Orthopaedic day surgery team and nursing services enough for the excellent care I received in October 2021 in Forth Valley Royal Hospital.  
I felt safe and supported throughout my time spent with them and all the staff were very professional and unfailingly kind towards me.  
A few days after my operation someone enquiring how I had found the experience I honestly replied that apart from the need to have the surgery it had been a lovely day out!

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

title: Lovely Dental Clinic but…
body: …terrible reception staff in the clinic downstairs.  The toilet in the Dental Clinic was being used so I ventured to take my daughter to the toilets in the clinic on the floor below.  I was challenged about this in an aggressive, suspicious and unnerving manner by a member of staff on Reception.  She had a quite inappropriate affect when addressing me in front of my daughter.  Then she proceeded to reprimand the Dental Clinic receptionist over the phone so that the people in the waiting room couldn’t have missed what was being said.  My daughter and I were wearing masks and we have never been challenged about using the downstairs toilet before.  I felt angry, as I don’t expect to be addressed in such a way, especially in front of my daughter.  The staff at the Dental Clinic, in contrast, were friendly and polite.

author: Babette
title: Wonderful staff
body:
I had my hip replacement yesterday and can I say a huge thank you to all the staff at DGRI for their care and attention from the minute I came into the hospital Nothing was a bother to them and all my questions were answered and some, leaving me relaxed about what was to follow. Thank you to the staff in Theatre 3, Mr Cree and his team. The staff in post op and now short stay have also been wonderful .  
The NHS really is a wonderful experience if you find yourself in a situation where you need them

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

title: Fantastic and empowering midwives
body: Had a wonderful experience at PAH birthing unit recently, the three midwives who were with me gave me such incredible support and encouragement, I felt so empowered and really well taken care of. It was a very fast labour and when I arrived I was very scared and in a lot of pain but they literally welcomed me with open arms and I instantly relaxed and knew I was in safe hands. I can’t shout out the names of the midwives in this review, but they said it was a really lovely experience for them too (and luckily a quiet day) so hopefully you know who you are - one was a student midwife and she was really great; so hands on and caring and reassuring. Thank you so much, you all gave me the birth experience I always wanted!

title: Awful service
body: 95 year old man with fractured numerous left in A and E for 6 hours and told nothing but lies, saying you will be next etc. Disgraceful service and attitude.

author: Jen2609
title: Compassionate and responsive staff
body:
I was in Ward 72 to be induced and the midwives were all friendly and informative. After 24 hours I was ready to go to the Labour ward, but it took a couple of days to get there due to emergencies and the volume of labours/births. Once I was on the Labour ward, my waters were broken and I was started on a hormone drip.  
For the first few hours I coped well with this, but then it all became a bit too much. The midwife (Rebecca) was very supportive for both me and my partner. She recommended various pain relief options. I was being sick and just felt like I couldn’t cope at all with the pain. Again, Rebecca continued to offer support and was respectful of my wishes.  
I initially coped well, but after a few hours I was emotionally drained and distressed by everything, then baby wasn’t coping well. I can’t remember who came in the room but there were a few people. I remember Melanie the Anaesthetist and the Consultant who were both lovely. After 8 hours I was still the same 1cm dilated I’d been 3 days previously. I was in pain and baby was distressed.  
An emergency section was recommended due to baby’s distress, which was either to be done by general anaesthetic or I think it was epidural. They explained the risks, gained consent and then I was in an operating room.  
I found the whole experience terrifying, but the staff all did an amazing job at reassuring me and updated my partner until he could join me. Even during the epidural (I’m terrified of needles) they kept me informed and relaxed. I don’t remember a lot from that night because I had myself so emotionally distressed, but my baby arrived safely and I just want to thank everyone who played a part in looking after me and my baby that night. They might not be here today if it wasn’t for their quick reaction and compassion in supporting me and my partner during a difficult time.

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: Fricy
title: Antenatal Care appointment was not acceptable
body:
I am currently pregnant with my 3rd child.  
I am high risk pregnancy due to existing blood conditions and during my first pregnancy in 2012 I developed HELLP syndrome which resulted in baby being born by emergency c-section at 32 weeks. During my second pregnancy things were much smoother and baby was born at 38 weeks by planned section due to my platelet count reducing.  
On finding out that I was pregnant again at around 3 weeks I phoned antenatal and requested I be referred to the same doctor my previous pregnancies, however I was told that this was not possible as systems had changed and I would have to complete an online form. Having not heard back from anyone after 2 weeks I followed this up and was told that no one would be in contact until approx 12 weeks gestation. I advised that this was not an option as I would require blood thinning medication prior to 6 - 8 weeks to lessen chance of miscarriage. I was advised they would put a flag on the system and a midwife would be in touch for booking appointment when possible. Another week or 2 passed and I still had not heard from anyone regarding medication and therefore had to contact haematology to get access to the medication I require.  
This is the first pregnancy where I have been tested for Gestational Diabetes, which unfortunately was confirmed as positive at 28 weeks. On receiving diagnosis I was sent a link for a dietician video regarding dietary adjustments and given an appointment to attend to get testing kit and further information. This appointment (Thursday) advised of the risks of GD and why it happens during pregnancy. It was reassuring to know that there was nothing that I had done that had caused this and that it was due to hormonal changes during pregnancy. On being given the testing kit I was advised to monitor my blood sugars 4x a day (first thing in the morning and 2 hours after meals) I was also given parameters that my levels should be under. I would then have an appointment with the diabetic team on the Tuesday to review.  
The appointment I attended on that Tuesday is possibly the worst hospital appointment I have ever attended in my life. On going into the room there was a medical student, antenatal consultant and another doctor, the dietician then also joined us. The dietician and doctor we intimidating and condescending towards me regarding my dietary choices - bearing in mind I had not been asked to make any major changes at this stage. I was chastised for not watching the full video I had been sent the link to - although parts of the video are helpful that alone does not prepare you for the changes to be made due to GD - I highly recommend GDUK for information on dietary changes. I understand that watching the video is expected and required but as a working mother of 2 with a hectic schedule I just hadn't had time in the 4 days. However the dietician made me feel like I was to blame for the situation which is not helpful for any pregnant woman.  
The doctor also had not read my medical notes and made no effort to check these at all, presuming this was my first pregnancy, asking me to list all of my medical conditions and then asking me questions regarding the medications I was prescribed and how the doseage is not what they would recommend - I explained that it is the same dose as I was on in both previous pregnancies and they continued on to say that haematology must not be aware of the new guidance etc - all this information is in my notes, which were right in front of them. This attitude towards me was awful from start to finish and the consultant actually looked apologetic and pointed out that the information was all in the notes in front of them.  
I have since contacted antenatal and requested my care be returned to my previous doctor as my consultant, this in itself was a difficult thing to do having phoned antenatal/midwives twice and never had a call back to confirm if this would happen and resulting in my having to email the antenatal consultants secretary to discuss directly with the previous doctor.  
On returning to diabetic clinic for my follow up appointment 4 weeks later I was seen by a midwife in the first instance and she could not have been more understanding of my situation which was so appreciated by me and my husband. There was a different consultant there today - However the midwife did offer to ask for my previous doctor to come to see me if that would be more comfortable for me. After some discussion I decided I would be OK with the new doctor so long as it was not the doctor I had seen the previous month, and this appointment went well.  
I understand that the NHS is under an enormous amount of pressure and everyone can have a bad day but the way I was spoken to, judged and treated at that appointment is just not acceptable when you are looking for guidance and advice to ensure a positive outcome in your pregnancy.

title: Wonderful team of staff
body: I recently underwent total knee replacement surgery and from the moment I stepped onto ward 18 the care I received was outstanding. This also includes the theatre staff who supported me  throughout the time during surgery. I am now in the hands of a superb physiotheraphy team on the road to revovery. Well Done NHS

author: gratefulrel
title: Positive experience and lovely staff
body:
My mum who suffers from dementia was recently taken to ward 101 after falling and banging her head  
I was am very grateful to the staff in 101 as they showed great compassion and kindness  
My mum and dad both suffer from dementia and when me and my dad visited my mum the staff couldn’t have been more of a help to us. Dr Carter the consultant was just outstanding and took time to explain everything to me about my mum but also didn’t dismiss my dad just because of his dementia. Unfortunately this does happen when we are in hospital, so thank you. The care we received was great despite the ward being very busy  
A very kind nurse Rachel made us a lovely tea tray so my mum and dad could have a tea and biscuits together and she took time to chat to me as well about how we all were coping. So thank you and to all staff for the care received keep up the great work.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Simona
title: Dizziness
body:
After a minor stroke 3 years ago, suffered constantly with dizziness. Not able to go out and walk by myself.  
Referred to Physio dept at Borders General Hospital and given Vestibular rehabilitation exercises over a period of 6 weeks and noticed a huge difference with balance. Now most days I feel normal again but have the occasional day of dizziness which I was told to expect if stressed or ill.  
Can't thank the Physio enough

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Tegang
title: They made me feel comfortable during my Gastroscopy
body:
Had real trouble getting a canula in and was convinced I couldn’t do the procedure without sedation. Everyone on the ward was lovely and trying so hard to help me calm down and take my mind off things!  
The endoscopist came round when it was evident the canula wouldn’t work and was so nice and understanding and really made me feel great about going ahead.  
I decided to go ahead without sedation and just the throat numbing spray and every single person in the procedure room made me feel comfortable and we’re joking around with me but still remained very professional.  
The procedure went without a hitch and the endoscopist was amazing as was everyone else I interacted with.  
They really made me feel comfortable. Thank you to everyone on the ward and everyone that helped me during my procedure!  
Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy

author: shudderhp37
title: My Care So Far...
body:
I would like to say thank you to the Radiotherapy team who were wonderful throughout my care, they were all very kind during my treatment. The receptionist at the Sunrise Centre, was very nice when I was checking in for my Radiotherapy appointments.  
The people that looked after me, the dietitian KT was very helpful, as well as Ingrid, who helped me my physio - I wouldn't want to do without them when going through my treatment - they were a life line, positive, helpful, giving me lots of information which is key when you are trying to get eating again.  
When I was on Lowen ward, the catering team, particularly , they were all very helpful in giving me anything that could help get me started with eating again after my nasal gastro tube was removed, they were very kind and encouraging - whatever they could do to help me, they did.  
Dr Endean in Rheumology took a lot of time to talk to me about my treatment and to find what was right to help me with spinal fractures.  
Dr Sulieman, in the Mermaid Centre, she spoke to me on the phone and was also very nice to me throughout my care.

author: Berfn76
title: Had Gynaecology exam
body: All staff kind and caring cannot thank them all enough thank you

author: ShonaB
title: Excellent care
body:
I recently had a stay at the Day Surgery Unit at Queen Margaret Hospital, Dunfermline for a cancer related surgery. The pre and post op care was exemplary and I was kept informed by all healthcare professionals throughout my stay. Before surgery , I was visited by all members of the team who explained their roles and what the process would be and the nursing care pre and post operative care was excellent. The anaesthetist and surgeon were both timely in reviewing me post op and I felt cared for at all times throughout my stay.  
The facilities in my room were clean and the only improvement I would make is the standard of the food that came from the kitchen. It was lukewarm at best but as I was only there for one night it wasn’t too much of a problem.

author: Daughter82
title: The nurses helped make a devastating time bearable
body:
My father was terminally ill with cancer. We cared for him at home. We could not have done it without the support of the district nursing team.  
Maria, Judith, Ashley and Joanne were brilliant with my father and treated him with compassion and respect throughout. He was able to talk to them about his fears. When he was near the end of his illness, they made sure he maintained his dignity and was comfortable.  
We,as a family, will always be thankful for the kindness and support they provided to my dad and family. They were able to reassure us that we were doing what was best for dad and nothing was too much trouble. The nurses helped make a devastating time bearable. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Acute Care at Home is a fantastic arrangement
body:
Story told by carer of female patient aged 80+ from Derry/Londonderry area  
Staff were very informative and explained the treatment clearly. It was so important that the 89 year old patient remained at home where her husband and family could help with giving support to her emotionally and physically. I do not think this lady would have survived being take to hospital as she had advanced dementia and the current pressures on A&E could not have delivered the individual care needed. Acute Care at Home is a fantastic arrangement and I feel it is saving lives!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: LisaMcA
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Relieved and impressed at Acute Care at Home
body:
Story told by carer of female 80+ year old patient from Derry/Londonderry area  
Excellent service. We were very relieved and impressed, especially with Sister Maire. Many thanks

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: EvaB
title: The best care
body:
My Mum recently had a short stay in the respiratory ward 3a at the Ulster inpatient block. As a family, we've been blown away by the staff. Their kind and helpful attitude really made my mum comfortable and much less stressed which undoubtedly aided her recovery. The room was clean, the nurses were knowledgeable and nothing was ever too much of an ask. Mum had a drain in place and was uncomfortable but never waited long for pain relief, the team was right there when she needed them.  
Everyone was chatty and friendly which made mum feel much more at ease. While I visited everyday, I felt reassured mum was safe and getting first class care in my absence, which took much pressure off me to get things done around Mum's home and take care of my 89 yr old grandmother who mum supports  
I have worked in the NHS for 10 years, the last 4 in England and the standard of care my mum received was out of this world and that means so much out family. You are all amazing, Gods gift to patients. Thank you. Michelle, staff nurse, Martina, Sister and Nadine, student nurse - you're all huge assets to the ward, we are so grateful to you all for your input with mum.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Bigfella
title: Professional Cardiac support services.
body:
I think today’s appointment with the heart failure team was my fifth since I had started as a patient, and I think I have met with the whole team now. I can’t say enough about how professional and caring they are, and how they follow through with what they say they will do.  
Having heart problems is scary enough for most people, but the team certainly have made the treatment as easy and acceptable as they possibly could! Appointments are usually every 2 months and then phone calls in between, and all the time they put me at ease as much as possible, many thanks.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ed45
title: Successful rehab services
body:
I had my stroke on the Sunday . I had fallen down the stairs banging my head off the door. When Monday came I felt fine and went to the shop and bought my papers. I fell asleep and after I woke I couldn’t stand. NHS 24 was called and they suggested that I had had a stroke.  
I was taken to admission 1 , then moved onto ward 42. I was there for 2 weeks then I was transferred to Letham Ward in Cameron Hospital for continued rehabilitation. I’ve been at Letham Ward for around 18 weeks. Rehab was successful. I am walking out of here.

author: haveaheart58
title: At home antibiotic treatment post cardiac surgery
body:
A bacterial infection lead to an abnormal growth on my Mitral valve and surgery was required. Initially a mechanical replacement was proposed but as it turned out the surgeon was able to repair the valve.  
After a Mitral valve repair I was to undergo a 6 week course of 4 hourly antibiotic treatments. After 4 weeks it was decided that and arranged with my local health clinic that the remaining treatment could be administered at home via a once a day visit by the district nursing team.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: bargainef96
title: Care and treatment is out of this world
body:
Where to start? The care and treatment that you receive from Ward 9 at Lagan Valley, in my opinion, is out of this world. When I was feeling uncomfortable from the beginning I was put at ease right away. More people need to know how important this ward is and the care they provide is out of this world!  
The after care inc as well! honestly couldn't ask for anything better from the staff! thank you so much Ward 9!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Hannah111
title: Having my second baby
body: I had to be induced which then turned into another emergency C-section for myself. The 10 hours of labouring I was accompanied by my partner and a midwife called Rachael. She was the loveliest, caring midwife and really helped me through the process. She finished her shift just as I was going into theatre so didn't get to see my son, but the next day she came to visit me on my ward by her own accord. Thank you so much Rachael!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Kelcw84
title: My health visitor
body:
I just want to share my story about my amazing health visitor Claire. I met her when I was 18 years old when I was pregnant. I am now 20 and my child is nearly 2 which means my journey with Claire is coming to an end in January.  
Claire is an amazing women. She is kind generous and so so caring. From the minute I met Claire I knew I would build a great relationship with her. She has been there for me through very bad times and good times. After I had my child I had it very hard as I was in a lot of pain. One morning when Claire called I cried to her as I was so sore and my GP wouldn't see me. Claire then got me seen quickly at the hospital by ringing them and explaining my situation.  
She also has helped me a lot when I found out my child had a cows milk allergy. I was a young mum not knowing what to do. Claire guided me and helped me in every way she could! She always praises me telling me how much of a good mum I am and telling me how well I'm doing! I'm going to be devastated when I don't see Claire daily but I know she'll always be there for me as that's what type of women she is! Claire deserves praise for what she does! Because she's definitely way more than just a health visitor to me. I wish her all the best with her career I wouldn't have came this far without her!!!!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: julietsc68
title: Organised day surgery
body:
Dental surgery within day surgery unit  
A very organised department - every staff member was very helpful from the first contact with reception staff. Everything was explained very clearly and they had the time to listen despite being a very busy department  
It was a very calm personable and reassuring atmosphere  
They were also able to provide follow up advice after discharge

author: drc808
title: Moving On speech, Women’s services
body: An ex patient talked about what it is like when she spent over a decade here. Patient talked about how she behaved and how she turned things around and is now in low secure and preparing to move to sheltered accommodation with community mental health support.  I found it reassuring  when it comes to my turn to move on.  Patient was very funny and she shared lots of stories of her time at Rampton and how she progressed to medium then to low and how that was for her.  It was very inspiring and very brave.  The patient was incredible and she should be very proud.

author: Zoeigh
title: Wonderful care
body: My son had an accident and split open his chin. He was triaged and seen within a timely manner. The staff were caring and kind, especially Julia based in the minors department.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Nina27
title: A lovely nurse who is great at her job,&really knows people
body: We went to the neurophysiology department 23/11 @08:30 at Manchester children's hospital, with our 8 year old autistic son. He had to have an EEG which, due to his complex needs, was very stressful for him & us. After a difficult journey from Wigan & a massive change in routine for Samuel, this nurse, Lucy, was fantastic. I can't praise her enough. She was practical, compassionate, caring & understanding. She was non judgemental & needs to be cherished & rewarded for her 'can do' attitude, & her skills both professionally & in showing empathy for a difficult time for us & our son. I hope senior management are aware what a gem they have. Thank you Lucy

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: WeeB
title: I need to have in writing the details of my ms, Diagnosed etc
body: As above, i need to have in writing if i could the diagnoses and time frame of my MS. please from my consultant.

author: Pricy86
title: Excellent care at the hospital
body: My mother-in-law had a scheduled appointment in the dermatology department last week. The way they looked after her from the reception through to the treatment was wonderful, everyone was so kind and very professional, she felt she was in very safe hands. The leg wound is healing nicely now, so a very big thank you to everyone at the dermatology department.

author: Joloso
title: Renal Team has been nothing short of magnificent
body:
My husband developed a new renal condition a few days into the first coronavirus lockdown, two days after the birth of our baby. Within 24 hours of us realising something serious was wrong with him, he was admitted to the renal ward of Belfast City Hospital & having a renal biopsy to get a diagnosis. This prompt action was out-standing considering the renal team were coping with the enormous pressures & challenges the covid-19 pandemic had brought and the hospital was morphing into the NI Nightingale facility.  
In the past 20 months since his diagnosis he has been reviewed face-to-face by this amazing team every 2-3 weeks, despite the professional challenges they endure due to the on-going health crisis.  
When he recently became suddenly unwell on three occasions, this wonderful medical team have speedily been contactable & arranged direct ward admission to treat my husband safely and promptly.  
The medical care he has received during this difficult period of our lives has been nothing short of magnificent. We are lucky to have such a world class health service, which astonishingly is free of cost.  
We will be eternally grateful to these superheroes & no amount of thanks can ever really convey our appreciation.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Chrdr69
title: Myomectomy procedure New Stobhill Hospital Clinic F
body: Iattended clinic F @ Stobhill for a myomectomy. Dr Wong, was very quick efficient and explained everything, and very generously covered for the consultant that cancelled my appointment that morning. The nurses Shirley, Fiona, Margaret and Karen were supportive and kind, can't thank you all enough for making the procedure the best it could be in terms of reassurance and kindness. Karen was particularly kind, at both my appointments and I really valued her gentle, reassuring, knowledgeable approach, she gave me real confidence to attend the second appointment. thank you for everything a fantastic team 😊

author: demixmcfall
title: Newborn bronchiolitis
body:
My little boy who was only 19 days old had to be blue lighted to the children's hospital in Glasgow Sunday afternoon! When he got there he was transferred to CDU and kept an eye on, before being discharged home he took a really bad turn and stopped breathing for several seconds. The staff being quick acting managed to keep bringing him round and not only that when the situation was stressful, they helped reassure my husband and I that everything was going to be okay.  
He was then placed upstairs to the ICU where I can’t thank the staff enough, Nicola was absolutely amazing with him on day shift and I felt that she gave him the love especially when I wasn’t there in the morning and when going home. Nightshift we sadly never met but always happy and chatty when we called and had nothing but lovely things to say about my boy!  
He was then moved along to ward 2C who were just amazing. They went out of their way for not only him but myself and my husband. Always making sure we were okay and if we ever needed anything. No question was a silly question, we became a bit paranoid about his breathing but the lovely nurse put him on the sats machine and pulse machine so it could ease our minds he was doing just as amazing as they all said! Nightshift we’re lovely and I cannot fault them at all! Making sure it was okay to check him over (always was of course) but just not wanting to disturb him too much!  
I honestly will be forever grateful for this service and what they have done for us. From the paramedics who stayed with me until he was admitted to the ward, to every single staff member and also the student nurses who dealt with him they will forever hold a special place in my heart especially when I thought I was going to loose my little boy!

author: PregFalk2021
title: Not feeling safe in the Forth Valley Women and Children Wing
body: All staff are lovely and friendly. However, on my regular maternity appointments reception staff in particular are not wearing masks or have them loosely hanging about their chin including the staff member allocated to asking handing out masks to patients. In the clinic the mask only covers a member of staff's face when they leaves their desk. They appear to think the plexiglass surround will stop airborne covid virus from spreading. I'm not feeling safe from coronavirus as a result. Windows are closed in the clinic waiting room too. Surely with so many vulnerable people coming in and out staff would be more careful and considerate. Please make improvements ASAP.

title: Great practice
body: I have been with this surgery for 40 years with not one bad experience, I lost my Dad in December 2020 and was not in a very good place and after blubbering to a very compassionate receptionist she kindly told me she would have a doctor call within the hour which he did he was so kind and understanding and made me feel at ease, I had follow up phone consultations from the doctor to see if I was ok, I honestly can not fault them they were there for me at a time when I was at my very lowest and I truly appreciate that, Thank you all so very much.

title: Miserable receptionist needs people skills.
body: I went to this medical center to pick up some paperwork only to face a miserable looking receptionist. Why are they in these jobs, if they are scared their face will crack if they smiled. It's bad enough feeling ill as well as facing a sour face. It's a long time since I'd been here. Now I see why? On my previous visits I had the same thing, so not much has changed. A little bit of empathy to a patient goes a long way. Back to my paperwork the receptionist couldn't find it. So I had to go back for this paperwork the following day when it was found. But I have to say once you get past the receptionist and irritating  automation service and see a doctor whom are always considerate. They deserve all the credit. They are the people whom make patients feel their self worth. So why is it so hard to see any of them.

title: gone so far downhill, they buried themselves
body:
having been with the practice 30 odd years, the latest partners seem money driven in the extreme whilst encouraging front line staff to deflect anyone away from see / speaking to a medic; they are so rude, if you can't get through by 10 past 8 in the morning forget an appointment and now they have refused me the drugs I need as they are too expensive; yet recommended on the NHS website

such a shame, used to be so good

title: Trying to get a doctor call back appointment
body: I have rang up the gp surgery every day since Monday 22nd until Thursday 25th November… I have been told there are no telephone appointments to ring back the next day … which I did … then told to ring back on Wednesday as they could release some for next week so I could prebook. I rang back Wednesday to be told no and my gp is on annual leave from Thursday until the middle of December but I could ring the week before he back and prebook a telephone consultation.. I was also told to ring on Thursday and get the duty gp which I did .. and was then told because my dr actually doesn’t start his holiday until after today I couldn’t book any telephone consultations with him nor could I with the duty gp.. I was advised to ring again tomorrow and I informed the receptionist that I was working all day tomorrow On a ward from 7 until 9.30  and I possibly couldn’t ring but could I book for tomorrow I was told no… so another week has gone and I remain in pain.. I don’t think I have been to my doctor for over a year and I am not the type of person to ring the doctor for anything… I think this is appalling and disgraceful service and I’m sure it will be the same next week .. it is not the receptionist  fault … but I do feel you are fobbed off and just told anything to get you off the phone… as not one receptionist has said the same thing and if they didn’t know they should be informed as they all should be saying the same thing as it is annoying to be told one thing and when you ask is this definitely going to happen they say yes and when you ring up you are told no… I don’t think anything will come of this review but i am hoping at least someone will read it.. I do hope you will improve your service as it is actually diabolical.

title: Does exactly what is says on the tin
body:
I was suffering from insomnia for about 9 months. I was shown the sleep therapy videos by the Insomnia Team which were very clear and  helped me understand what I needed to do to help myself. Along with the diary, I managed to put some structures in place to improve my sleep and am regularly sleeping all the way through the night!

Very happy customer

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: Very pleased with the outcome of the procedure  and the staff were very welcoming and professional  at all times during both visits,one the consultation  and two to carry out the removal of cataract and replace the lens

title: Health assistance no problem.
body:
I have been a patient at Plympton Health Centre since inception and through this considerable period during both normal and very difficult times such as the pandemic we are currently experiencing I have required at various times medical advice, or treatment from Beacon staff of almost every level, even though many staff have come and gone the very high sense of dedication skill and caring continues despite measures introduced to protect patients from covid infection, this increasing the workload to all. 
A debt of gratitude is owed to all staff of Beacon Health Centre for continuing to operate a first class service under the present very difficult conditions.

title: Impossible appointment.
body:
With the transfer to the lighthouse group  making an appointment is near on impossible. 
Even If the staff bothered to answer the phone,

title: Dismissive and Discriminatory
body:
The reception staff and practice manager need to learn not to discriminate against people based on how they look. I was denied use of the bathroom on two separate occasions as they were only for "vulnerable patients". I was a patient and unwell but deemed to be not vulnerable enough, I was sent me outside to the car park to use the public toilet which was closed. It was a humiliating experience and I made a complaint to the Practice manager.
He said it was a failure of communication which he would rectify with the reception staff. Clearly they ignored him as it happened again when I returned the following week. On the second occasion I had to ask 4 times to access the toilet. Deeply humiliating and clearly based on judgement of 'need' by the reception staff. You would think that there would be training in a GP surgery for staff to understand that not all ailments are visible eg. Crohn's. I can only hope that some training has been put in place before I have to return again.

Ps. I understand that Covid is an issue but if the surgery is open and accepting patients there is a duty to provide toilet facilities to those patients even if extra cleaning is an inconvenience to the staff.

title: Poor management
body:
I accompanied my wife to A&E after GP advised her to attend as she had AF & associated worrying symptoms. She was very anxious & wanted me to help communicate with staff so she didn’t forget to mention the various issues she had, I was refused permission to sit with her despite her anxiety due to ‘Corvid’ I could have had a test or evidenced I’d had one etc but this was not ‘acceptable’ 
After working in the NHS for many years as DNS etc & more recently as an advisor to Regulators I found the lack of communication, consideration & practical flexibility poor. You are met at the entrance by a security guy with instructions I understand all to well that staff are stretched etc etc but adding to a patient’s anxiety unnecessarily doesn’t help
